input.name: __VIEWSTATE

br.span: Enroll your student for the 2020-21 school year online and submit all necessary paperwork via computer or phone!

span.p: We’ll be sending you regular updates during this extended closure to share any new information and to remind you about previous messages we don’t want you to have missed. Some updates will be shorter and some will be longer, but we’ll be staying in touch.
Even though our schools and offices are closed, our faculty and staff are still committed to working hard each day on behalf of every student and family.

li.p: Shaker Heights Schools students and parents/guardians are invited to complete the Distance Learning and Supports Survey to share feedback on your experiences with learning and teaching, communications and family engagement during the extended school closure. Please note: Families with multiple students in the District may wish to complete one survey per student.

College Board has canceled the SAT exam scheduled for Saturday, June 6, 2020. Students will have opportunities to take the SAT to make up for this spring’s lost administrations. Visit SAT and PSAT-Related Coronavirus Updates for more information.
ACT has announced it will offer a flexible schedule for summer 2020 test dates and test-at-home options for fall/winter 2020. Read this ACT press release for more information.

Mark your calendars for Administrative Professionals Day on Wednesday, April 22 and Teacher Appreciation Week from May 4-8. Please consider sending an email or note of appreciation to any of our building/District administrative assistants and to our teachers!
Complete a Technology Tools Request to request a District-issued Chromebook (grade K-4) or hotspot device (grades K-12) if you do not have home internet service.
A reminder that Shaker Heights Schools has added weekend meal distribution and changed delivery days to Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Please review the Extended Closure Meal Distribution Plan.

The District has begun distributing Sprint Hotspots to those who requested them. Review the Sprint Hotspot Instructions for the ZTE Warp Connect Hotspot or the R850 Hotspot, depending on which hotspot you received. If you have issues with your Sprint hotspot, call 216-295-5550. Please do not contact Sprint.
The District is offering online enrollment for the 2020-21 academic year. Parents and guardians may submit required forms electronically by computer or mobile phone. Learn about online enrollment.

a.strong: Extended Closure Tech Resources and Chromebook Support

li.p: Using Express Update to Update Your Student's Information (to ensure the District has your current contact information)
Remote Learning Resource Guide (from the Ohio Department of Education)

div.div: If any of the material on this page is not accessible to you or you have questions, please send us an email or call us via our contact page and we will provide alternatives.
